medium_description_en: Assesses appropriate response to anemia, frequently in sickle cell patients.
short_description_en: Adequacy of marrow response to anemia.

seo.meta_description_en: The Absolute Reticulocyte Count & Reticulocyte Index Assesses appropriate response to anemia, frequently in Sickle Cell Disease patients.
seo.keywords_en: Absolute Reticulocyte Count & Reticulocyte Index, reticulocyte, reticulocyte index, reticulocyte count, reticulocyte interpretation, reticulocyte calc, reticulocyte calculator, reticulocyte score, reticulocyte, sickle cell count, anemia, anemia calc, anemia eval, anemia evaluation, sickle cell anemia calc, sickle cell calc

how_to_use.use_case_en: Determining if an anemic patient is mounting an appropriate response to their anemia, or if they have an inadequate marrow response (either from the marrow itself or a nutrient deficiency, or the blood loss was too rapid for reticulocyte response).
how_to_use.why_use_en: The laboratory “reticulocyte count” is actually a percentage. The absolute count corrects for the level of anemia, and the reticulocyte index determines if the reticulocyte count is appropriate for the level of anemia.

next_steps.advice_en:
• Patients with an appropriate marrow response (high reticulocyte index) typically are not evaluated further.
  • Patients with an inappropriate marrow response (low reticulocyte index) may be further evaluated for nutritional deficiencies or marrow abnormalities.
  • Always consider transfusion and/or iron supplementation in anemic patients.

about.formula_en:
Absolute reticulocyte count = # or % retics * (pt's Hct / normal Hct)

Reticulocyte index = absolute reticulocyte count / maturation factor

Maturation factors:

Hematocrit Maturation factor
≥35% 1.0
25 to <35% 1.5
20 to <25% 2.0
<20% 2.5
